gives you the possibility to use an XSLT transformer implemented in Java (other than the XSLT transformers that come bundled with ). To use a different XSLT transformer, specify the name of the transformer factory class. sets this transformer factory class as the value of the Java property javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory.
You can customize the following XSLT preferences:

ul.li: Value - Allows the user to enter the name of the transformer factory Java class;
XSLT 1.0 Validate with - allows you to set the XSLT engine used for validation of XSLT 1.0 documents;
XSLT 2.0 Validate with - allows you to set the XSLT Engine used for validation of XSLT 2.0 documents;

XSLT 3.0 Validate with - allows you to set the XSLT Engine used for validation of XSLT 3.0 documents.Saxon-HE does not implement any XSLT 3.0 features. Saxon-PE implements a selection of XSLT 3.0 (and XPath 3.0) features, with the exception of schema-awareness and streaming. Saxon-EE implements additional features relating to streaming (processing of a source document without constructing a tree in memory. For further details about XSLT 3.0 conformance, go to http://www.saxonica.com/documentation/index.html#!conformance/xslt30.
